bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: GIMP-2.9 (Unstable) does not start since gegl03 update from gegl03-0.3.5-0.1.gitbb8fe84f2801.fc24.x86_64 to gegl03-devel-0.3.6-1.fc24.x86_64
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): gegl03-devel-0.3.6-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. install GIMP-2.9 (Unstable) from https://copr-be.cloud.fedoraproject.org/results/nphilipp/gimp-unstable/fedora-$releasever-$basearch/ 2. run 'gimp-2.9' from console
Actual results: Error message from GIPM and the following output on the text console: [pasiasty@lilith3-localdomain x86_64]$ gimp-2.9 GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gblur-1d.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gblur-1d.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN2v___exp_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/fattal02.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/fattal02.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN4vv___powf_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/bilateral-filter.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/bilateral-filter.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN2v___exp_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gaussian-blur-selective.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gaussian-blur-selective.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN2v___exp_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/softglow.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/softglow.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN2v___exp_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/exposure.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/exposure.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN4vv___powf_finite GEGL-geglmodule.c-Message: Module '/usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gaussian-blur.so' load error: /usr/lib64/gegl-0.3/gaussian-blur.so: undefined symbol: _ZGVbN2v___exp_finite
Expected results: gimp-2.9 running as when gegl03-0.3.5-0.1.gitbb8fe84f2801.fc24.x86_64 is installed

Hi Cezary,
please check out the updated gimp-unstable and gegl03/babl packages. The gimp-unstable package for version 2.9.4 is available from COPR:
https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/nphilipp/gimp-unstable/
I've submitted the necessary babl and gegl03 versions as updates, they should be pushed to testing shortly, you can download them from koji in the interim, see the description in COPR.
gegl03-0.3.8-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-4962347737

Hi Nils,
The newest GIMP on COPR is still 2.9.2. It doesn't even start with gegl03-0.3.8-1 - I've tried with both downloaded rawhide binary and rebuilt RPM:
[pasiasty@lilith3-localdomain ~]$ gimp-2.9 /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: symbol lookup error: /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: undefined symbol: gegl_param_multiline_get_type

(In reply to Cezary Zemis from comment #3) > Hi Nils, > > The newest GIMP on COPR is still 2.9.2. It doesn't even start with > gegl03-0.3.8-1 - I've tried with both downloaded rawhide binary and rebuilt > RPM: > > [pasiasty@lilith3-localdomain ~]$ gimp-2.9 > /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: symbol lookup error: /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: > undefined symbol: gegl_param_multiline_get_type
Same with Koji's binaries (http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=786939).

(In reply to Cezary Zemis from comment #4) > (In reply to Cezary Zemis from comment #3) > > Hi Nils, > > > > The newest GIMP on COPR is still 2.9.2. It doesn't even start with > > gegl03-0.3.8-1 - I've tried with both downloaded rawhide binary and rebuilt > > RPM: > > > > [pasiasty@lilith3-localdomain ~]$ gimp-2.9 > > /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: symbol lookup error: /opt/gimp-2.9/bin/gimp-2.9: > > undefined symbol: gegl_param_multiline_get_type > > Same with Koji's binaries > (http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=786939).
Got GIPM 2.9.4 - now it works (i.e. no undefined symbols in GEGL).

gegl03-0.3.8-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-4962347737
gegl03-0.3.8-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
